title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, October 26, 1862
summary: Hotchkiss writes of bad weather that has delayed him at an inn while scouting, and relates news of the people he met there. He spent the next night at Mt. Sidney, and relates news of people from there as well.
keywords: Church/Religious Activity, Women, Home Front, Slavery, African Americans, Military Authority, Family, American Civil War
